N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 349-1.2 - Filing of report of attending therapist

State Regulations
(a) All therapy reports filed by an attending
therapist must contain his or her New York State license number, address and
telephone number. (b) Every
therapist shall file the following reports directly with the chairman, with the
prescribing or referring authorized physician or in the case of physical
therapy, authorized physician or podiatrist, with the employer or the
employers' carrier, if known, and with the claimant's licensed representative
or attorney representing the claimant before the board upon the written request
of such representative or attorney accompanied by a notice of retainer and
consent to such transmittal signed by the claimant: (1)
within 48 hours following first
treatment, a 48-hour preliminary report; (2)
within 30 days after filing the 48-hour
preliminary report and in no event later than 32 days after first treatment, a
30-day report giving a complete report of injury and treatment; (3)
thereafter and during continuing
treatment and without further request, progress reports at intervals of 30 days
or less; (4)
immediately upon
termination of treatment, a final report regardless of the date the last
previous report was filed, except that where treatment is terminated within 48
hours following first treatment, the 48-hour preliminary report shall
constitute the final report if so noted thereon; and
(5)
additional or more frequent reports when
requested by the chairman and within three workdays after such request is
made. (c) Whenever a
report is filed with the chairman by an attending therapist after the time
within which it is to be filed, as provided herein, has elapsed, the therapist
shall attach thereto a signed and verified statement giving the true reason for
which he or she requests excuse for late filing. (d) Form OT/PT-4 is prescribed for the use of
physical therapists in filing the required reports. Notes
